intro: Synotoma, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange inflorescences that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Synotoma species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They play an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
